definition: to snort disdainfully/to scoff at/to turn up one's nose
laugh at/jeer/scoff at/sneer at
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
nose

sentences.english: You'll never sneer at Premium Economy again.
sentences.chinese: 你永遠也不會再對經濟艙嗤之以鼻。

sentences.english: Art harrumphed and tried to ignore the voice.
sentences.chinese: 藝術嗤之以鼻，並試圖忽視的聲音。
她對他的禮物嗤之以鼻。

sentences.english: No doubt the government contractors pshawed and pished over it.
sentences.chinese: 毫無疑問，政府承包商已對這事嗤之以鼻。

sentences.english: No he scorned the base insinuation.
sentences.chinese: 沒有，他對這種卑鄙的暗示嗤之以鼻。

sentences.english: The watchman just laughs at these stories.
sentences.chinese: 看門人尤里則對這些故事嗤之以鼻。

sentences.english: At first he sniffed at her foreign ways.
sentences.chinese: 起初他對她的外國作風嗤之以鼻。

sentences.english: Mr. Obama was dismissive when he should have been outraged.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬對此嗤之以鼻，他本應該義憤填膺。

sentences.english: Rebecca disdains the idea of having to arrive home by 10∶00 PM.
sentences.chinese: 麗貝卡對晚上10點以前必須回家的想法嗤之以鼻。

sentences.english: Now,as it happens,this is one I'm going to be completely dismissive of.
sentences.chinese: 而我對這個說法卻是完全嗤之以鼻的。

sentences.english: I don't think Americans are in any position to get too sniffy about this.
sentences.chinese: 我不覺得美國人有資格對此事嗤之以鼻。

sentences.english: Squirrels and thrushes can only look down on us and smile.
sentences.chinese: 松鼠和畫眉只能對遲鈍的我們嗤之以鼻，微微一笑。

sentences.english: And later, President Thomas Jefferson scoffed at the idea of having a day of thanksgiving .
sentences.chinese: 之後，傑弗遜總統還對這件事嗤之以鼻。

sentences.english: I gave him a thumbnail sketch of how to implement a Merge Sort on disk.
sentences.chinese: 對他怎樣在一個磁盤上執行合併分檢我嗤之以鼻。

sentences.english: Child-welfare professionals were contemptuous of the Holts.
sentences.chinese: 專業的兒童福利機構都對霍爾特嗤之以鼻。

definition: to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
to disdain to do sth/to think sth not worth doing/to feel it beneath one's dignity
to despise/to look down upon/despicable
to look down upon/to despise
to believe firmly without any doubt (idiom)/absolute certainty about sth
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to be disgusted with/to dislike/bad reaction/antipathy
to look down upon/to hold in contempt
to despise/to hold in contempt
to dismiss with a laugh/to make light of
argument/view (sometimes derogatory)
to loathe/to hate/disgusted with sth
to feel indignant/to feel aggrieved
to detest bitterly (idiom)/implacable hatred/to abhor/anathema
